seo.title: Beach hopping on the Amalfi Coast
seo.description: Which beaches to combine in a day, access tips, and costs.

linkLabel: Beach hopping on the Amalfi Coast
intro: Plan a beach-hopping day that balances ferry rides, cliffside views, and downtime on the sand.

sections.title: Morning: Positano to Fornillo
body: Start early on Spiaggia Grande for a quick dip, then walk the coastal path to Fornillo by 09:30 for calmer water.
Reserve sunbeds ahead if you want shade; otherwise pack a lightweight umbrella.

sections.title: Midday: Amalfi or Atrani
body: Take a late-morning ferry to Amalfi and lunch on the pier before swimming at the town beach or Atrani's pocket cove.
Store bags in Amalfi's deposit so you can explore hands-free.

sections.title: Group tours & shared boats
body: See our %LINK:boatTours|Boat tours in Positano guide% if you'd rather hop between beaches on a shared boat instead of ferries.
Operators depart from Positano's main pier; arrive 15 minutes early and confirm Laurito or Arienzo swim stops when booking.

sections.title: Evening: Sunset swim
body: Finish at Laurito or Arienzo for golden-hour views; both face west for warm light and fewer crowds after 17:00.
Take the last ferry or book a return taxi to avoid uphill hikes in the dark.

tips: Carry a quick-dry towel and change of clothes so you stay comfortable on ferries.
Pack snacks and at least 1 L / 34 oz of water—beach kiosks can run low on busy days.

faqs.q: Do I need to pre-book sunbeds?
a: Yes in July–August. Contact beach clubs via WhatsApp the day before to secure front rows.

faqs.q: Can I bring my own food?
a: Most free sections allow picnics. Beach clubs typically permit small snacks but prefer you purchase drinks from their bar.
